posts.post_content:
Seven power, seven toughness, seven life, seven cards...eight casting cost. You have no idea how much this annoys me. I hate whoever did that with a passion that burns like a thousand suns. One day in the paper you will read a story about how a local man was eaten alive by his own OCD, clutching a griselbrand in his cold, dead hand. That local man will be me.  
  
Gripes aside (twitch) i opened one in the prerelease and I (obviously) won all four games that this resolved. Even without the draw ability, the 14 point life swing a turn is a game-sealer. Definite shades of [baneslayer angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=baneslayer angel).
posts.html:
Seven power, seven toughness, seven life, seven cards...eight casting cost. You have no idea how much this annoys me. I hate whoever did that with a passion that burns like a thousand suns. Gripes aside (twitch) i opened one in the prerelease and I (obviously) won all four games that this resolved. Even without the draw ability, the 14 point life swing a turn is a game-sealer. Definite shades of baneslayer angel.

Posted By: Razbot (5/4/2012 10:03:10 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Why can't I like this guy? The Spike in me loves him, and he really does tip the game solidly in your favor... but I am used to demons having unusual player interactions, such as [Bloodgift Demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodgift Demon). Point being that flavor-wise, demons should not let you *choose* for them to use their power; they should use it whether you like it or not, and it should be up to you if that ends up working to your advantage.
posts.html:

Gris-el-brand. Vol-de-mort.  
  
Demon-That-Needs-No-Title/He-Who-Must-Not-Be-Named  
  
Make 7 Horcruxes: Gain infinite power. 7 IS the most powerfully magical number!  
  
[Lich](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lich).   
Lifelink? Seriously? Ookaaay...  
  
People would have flipped. their. shit. if this had been a Preview Mythic in Premium Decks: Graveborn.  
  
The difference between this guy and Mojo Jojo: Mojo Jojo doesn't know AVADA KEDAVRA.  
  
Give this guy Undying and Persist. You know you want to.

Posted By: bay_falconer (5/6/2012 1:14:26 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Just think of this guy hitting the field with a second-turn [Kaalia of the Vast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kaalia of the Vast) swing (In Commander, of course). Third turn, you're dropping whatever answer you pulled in those 35 cards you drew with Grislebrand. Add that to the 10 you've drawn so far (Assuming either multiplayer or draw first - 7 opening hand plus 3 for your 3 turns), and you're holding almost half your deck in your hand. Pop a [CHildren of Korlis](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=CHildren of Korlis) in the deck and you have ANOTHER 35 cards (We're up to 75 cards in hand here. On turn 3.)  
  
To be fair, a turn 2 hasty Kaalia is not entirely easy, but it is possible.

posts.post_content:
The irony of Griselbrand is I actually don't see you drawing very many 'real' cards with him actually.  
  
He's a 7/7 lifelinker with evasion.   
  
You combo him out, and start attacking people to kill them. His pay life ability offers him protection because people DON'T want you to do that in response to a kill spell to 'replace' him.  
  
Alright, so in Commander, he's just tiny and it's a very different story: They WILL want to kill him, you WILL...get a load of other cards anyway...and they WILL....die anyway. But he's banned there now so that doesn't count, exactly.  
  
My speculation, admitting no experience on it, is that in Legacy/Vintage, where you have less life to pay AND less life you need to take to win, is that he probably races/kills pretty fast and even tho you draw the cards anyway 'because they're free and you can', you probably don't actually get a chance to use them much. Your deck can do other things sure, if it's comboing it wants at least two different things to combo out, bu... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
